1.question: Maximo Jalife is mentioned in some reports, but I’m not sure what to do regarding this. Can you provide more context or guidance?

2.question: What should I put in the site field for Canada in Concur, and how do I show the currency I used?
2.human_answer:
In the report header, in the site field, just start typing the name of the country and it should appear for you to select. 
When adding an expense, at the end of the details box next the amount field, the currency field will appear. You can select the currency type there.

3.question: What is the process for returning funds for a Concur reimbursement?
3.human_answer: Explained the return of funds process to user.

4.question: Can I get a reimbursement for the conference fee associated with rz2557?
4.human_answer: Student must confirm if address information on profile is correct. If update needed can do so going to Student Services Online(SSOL). Thank you

5.question: Can you provide me with the Concur Expense Closing Schedule?
5.human_answer:
Concur Travel/Business Expense Reports
Concur will continue to be available to users during the ARC access lockout, AP will continue
to audit Expense Reports during this time. All Expense Reports that are fully approved
(departmental and AP) by June 26, 5pm will be paid in ARC on June 27. Expense Reports
submitted into workflow with at least a supervisor/initial reviewer approval and/or Travel and
Business Corporate Card transactions not assigned to an Expense Report (which is in
workflow) as of June 30 will be accrued through the automated ARC accrual process ensuring
that these expenses are reflected in FY24. Any Expense Report approved by AP during the
ARC access lockout will be paid on July 1.
Expense Reports which have not received at least a supervisor/initial reviewer approval and
Columbia Air/Rail Central Pay transactions not assigned to an Expense Report (which is in
workflow) will not be included in the ARC accrual process and will need to be addressed
Page 5 of 15
through a manual accrual process with the Controller's Office (detailed in Section 8,
REVENUE/EXPENSE ACCRUALS).
Expense Reports processed subsequent to the last file feeds from Concur will be posted in the
new fiscal year

See Year-End Transaction Processing Guidance  -
https://www.finance.columbia.edu/sites/default/files/content/Finance%20Documents/Accounting%20Operations/FY24%20Year-End%20Transaction%20Processing%20Guidance%20FINAL.pdf

11.question: I'm experiencing an SAP Concur error, but I'm unsure what to do about it.
11.human_answer:
As a student, you do not have default access to login to Concur. There are two options to reimburse you:

1. Your department can enter the expense report on your behalf using a "non-profiled payee" report type.

2. Your department can request to have you "opted in" to Concur so that you can login to Concur and enter the expense report yourself.

Please follow up with your department to see which option they want to use.

Timing issue due to the budget having to feed to ARC and then from ARC to Concur.

Thanks.

28.question: How can I become a Concur Travel Arranger?
28.human_answer:
To become a Concur Travel Arranger please submit a Financial Systems Security Application in Service Now by doing the following:
1. Go to columbia.service-now.com 
2. After logging in, click on "Catalog" 
3. Click on "Finance"
4. Click on "Show More" at the bottom of the page
5. Click on "Financial Systems Security Application"
Travel Arranger appears in section 2.1

44.question: I need help reconciling travel expenses for a guest in Concur.
44.human_answer:
When you are reconciling you don't do it under the non-profile payee, that is used to reimburse the traveler. In this case, you do it under your own profile, since you're just reconciling no payments will be issued. Here is the
Job aid: https://travel-expense.finance.columbia.edu/news/how-do-i-reconcile-corporate-card-or-airrail-central-pay-transactions
video job aid: https://www.finance.columbia.edu/content/reconciling-corporate-card-and-columbia-airrail-central-pay-transactions-concur

59.question: Hello, I am having an issue with processing an expense reimbursement for a speaker, Brian Baer, who participated in a conference this past spring. His vendor ID is 0000265607, but when I enter his name or vendor ID number in Concur, I receive an error message. Can you please advise? Thank you, Alexa.
59.human_answer:
Alexandra,
This person has a classification of "Supplier" . You can only process a reimbursement in Concur if the vendor's classification is "Outside Party"
For vendors with supplier classification you need to process the reimbursement through ARC on a check request and make sure to uncheck the withholding applicable box on the withholding information page
Thanks

76.question: Hello Finance, I booked car rentals for Music Department graduate students in Concur for an approved trip using the credit card of one of the graduate students, who will be reimbursed later. However, the Columbia Travel page states that the driver needs a credit card in their name when picking up the vehicles. Does the credit card used for booking need to match the driver's name on the reservation, or is it similar to the process at hotels where it is used as a backup? Thank you!
76.human_answer: The credit card that is presented at check-in does not have to match the credit card used to make the reservation. The credit card used to make the reservation will be used for the booking fee (if there is one). The credit card presented at check-in will be used for the car rental costs.

88.human_answer:
Please see this job aid with instructions on setting up your profile for Travel: https://www.finance.columbia.edu/content/setting-your-concur-profile-travel-and-expense-users

If that does not help resolve the issue please reach out to the Concur Online Booking Tool Support Center: 1-800-221-4730, Monday - Friday 8:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m. ET

89.question: In Concur, I need help on how to segregate a first class flight as the system is asking me to do so. Can you guide me on this? Thank you!

90.question: How do I reimburse a guest speaker for their travel expenses related to their visit to Columbia? Should I set them up through Paymentworks and select "goods" or "services"?
90.human_answer: create a vendor profile through paymentworks and can process reimbursement through concur once profile is approved

91.question: I am reconciling my Corporate Card for a hotel advance deposit, but I cannot submit my report before the trip end date. Also, I have a question about meal threshold overages. Can someone assist me?
91.human_answer: Please segregate the amount over the meal threshold.

92.question: I'm having trouble logging into Concur. I was told it can take a few days after activation in PAC for the Concur login to be activated. Can you confirm if I should try logging in again tomorrow?
92.human_answer: Can take a few days after you are activated in PAC for the Concur login to activate. Please try to login again tomorrow.

93.question: I found the job aid for creating an expense report in Concur and Columbia's travel policy. Can someone help clarify how to use them for my reimbursement for conference expenses?
93.human_answer:
Here is the job aid on how to create an expense report in Concur:
https://www.finance.columbia.edu/sites/default/files/content/Training%20Documents/Concur/Job%20Aids/Job_Aid_Concur_Creating_Expense_Reports.pdf

Here is Columbia's travel policy:
https://universitypolicies.columbia.edu/content/travel-expense-policy

94.question: How should I classify the expense for a day trip?
94.human_answer: Expense for a day trip should be submitted as a business expense. There has to be an overnight stay outside New York for  expense to be processed as a travel expense

95.question: Good morning, I am Christopher Yera, a postdoc with the CSSW CPSP team. I will be attending a conference in November representing our Center. If I register now, I will receive a discount. Can I get reimbursed now ahead of travel to the conference, and if so, what is the best way to proceed? Should I process it as a pre-travel advance in Concur or as a regular reimbursement? Thank you for your advice.
95.human_answer:
Air fare and registration fee /Membership fee can be reimbursed before end of trip
He can submit expense reimbursement request through concur

96.question: I need help with my meal expense report - can you guide me on how to itemize the meal, tax/tip, and segregate overages?
96.human_answer: Meal expense must be itemize - food/meal, tax and tips, and segregate overage.

97.question: I'm looking to enter an expense report under the Expense tab in Concur for expenses that I've already incurred. What steps should I follow?
97.human_answer: Enter an expense report under the Expense tab in Concur.

98.question: Could you clarify the mileage policy for using a personal vehicle for university business? I want to make sure I understand the reimbursement rates and what is allowable.
98.human_answer:
From the Travel policy (https://universitypolicies.columbia.edu/content/travel-expense-policy):

Travel by Private Vehicle                                            
When traveling for business purposes, a personal vehicle may be used in order to save time, transport equipment, reduce costs when several people are traveling together, or travel to locations within reasonable driving distance. If a personal vehicle is used primarily for the convenience of the traveler and the approved travel is to a location more than 500 miles beyond the point of origin, reimbursement will not exceed the lesser of the following: 1) the cost of per- mile reimbursement plus tolls; or, 2) the round-trip airfare between the nearest commercial airport serving the origin and destination cities, plus transfer costs to and from the airport.
                                                                       
For the business-related use of a personal vehicle, the traveler will be reimbursed at a rate based on the Federal IRS approved highway mileage guides. Mileage reimbursement covers fuel, maintenance/repairs, insurance, transportation and operating costs, so these will not be reimbursed separately. The traveler will not be reimbursed for the cost of vehicle purchase or lease.
                                                                       
In addition to the mileage allowance, tolls and necessary parking charges may be reimbursed.

                                                  

The University does not assume liability for damage to personal automobiles used on University business and does not assume liability for deductibles or any other uninsured loss to the vehicle. Expenses for vehicle repairs are not reimbursable. Under no circumstances will the University reimburse parking fines and moving violations on personal vehicle

 

Personal Vehicle Mileage Rate:

    $.655/miles for travel on or after January 1, 2023
    $.670/miles for travel on or after January 1, 2024

99.question: Does Concur calculate mileage for me, so I don't need to provide a map printout? Can I claim tolls when doing that?
99.human_answer:
Concur will calculate mileage for you so you don't need to provide a map printout. 
Tolls can be reimbursed when claiming personal car mileage.
